info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 20 at 8:35PM EDT until March 24 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Wakefield VA
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Virginia...
Nottoway River At Sebrell affecting Sussex and Southampton Counties.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia...
Blackwater River Above Franklin affecting City of Suffolk, Southampton, City of Franklin and Isle of Wight Counties.
Blackwater River above Zuni affecting Southampton and Isle of Wight Counties.
Blackwater River near Dendron affecting Surry County.
For the Chowan Basin...including Rawlings, Franklin at US Highway 58/258, Stony Creek, Sebrell, Lawrenceville, Emporia, Franklin... Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Blackwater River above Franklin.
* WHEN...From Friday morning to early Monday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 11.8 feet, A portion of State Route 611 in Southampton County, Joyners Bridge Road, is innundated. A portion of State Route 619, in Isle of Wight County, is flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 10.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 6.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 11.6 feet Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 10.8 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.7 feet on 08/19/1992. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 900 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO EARLY MONDAY MORNING

area.areaDesc: Isle of Wight, VA; Southampton, VA; City of Franklin, VA; City of Suffolk, VA
